author: Indhukrishna
body:
## Steps to reproduce

1) Install latest Windows PowerShell from repo on a Windows machine using the script Update-PSCore.cmd. Alternatively, use the script Validate-OPSFullCLROnWindows.ps1 to get the latest bits and install. 

2) Import-Module ScheduledTasks  
## Expected behavior

Module is imported
## Actual behavior

``` powershell
ipmo : Cannot process Cmdlet Definition XML for the following file:
C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\scheduledtasks\MSFT_ScheduledTask_v1.0.cdxml. The type initializer
for 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Cmdletization.ScriptWriter' threw an exception.
At line:1 char:1
+ ipmo scheduledtasks -verbose
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Import-Module], XmlException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Xml.XmlException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
```
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.10032.0
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v0.6.0-82-g34e62401883aaa7d13414cddbdcb29c87b0ebd72
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1

```
